column1:
The patient is recommended to receive short-term sub-acute rehab (SAR) following their surgery, which will focus on physical therapy, stair negotiation, and ADL training. The PDF indicates that the patient's discharge has been anticipated to occur within 2 to 3 days of this care plan, which also involves ambulating several times a day and encouraging deep breathing.

• Minimal Assistance: Meal preparation, household chores, driving, med management, shopping, bathing, ambulation, bowel/bladder, finances, dressing, transfers.
• Uses a cane and requests a walker for home use.
• Family helps periodically, but physical therapy recommended.
• 1:1 Feeding Assistance: NA
Page Numbers: 23,24,25,26

- Physical therapy (PT): 3–5 times/week, 125 feet ambulation, with a rolling walker; each session approximately 12 minutes.
- The patient is also recommended to have skilled physical therapy intervention for posture improvement and pain management.
